name: Islamic Educational Foundation
mission: ESTABLISH AND OPERATE PRE-SCHOOL, ELEMENTARY, HIGH SCHOOL.
theoryOfChange: By combining rigorous STEM/Arts education with prophetic character and Islamic studies, the school produces leaders who are both professionally successful and God-conscious.

evaluationSources: School of Excellence Award (mentioned for board member's previous school)
Accreditation reviews (mentioned via board member's role as lead evaluator)

zakatClaimEvidence: No evidence found for a US-based 'Islamic Educational Foundation' explicitly accepting zakat donations. The search results refer to 'Islamic Foundation of Toronto (IFT)' which is a Canadian organization, 'Islamic Relief', 'National Zakat Foundation' in the UK, 'Dawat-e-Islami' with its global madani markaz in Pakistan, and 'The Citizens Foundation (TCF)' which focuses on children in Pakistan.

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 18/50: LOW Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Education Foundation of New Jersey Inc shows good impact and limited alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: No evidence found for a US-based 'Islamic Educational Foundation' explicitly accepting zakat donations. The search results refer to 'Islamic Foundation of Toronto (IFT)' which is a Canadian organization, 'Islamic Relief', 'National Zakat Foundation' in the UK, 'Dawat-e-Islami' with its global madani markaz in Pakistan, and 'The Citizens Foundation (TCF)' which focuses on children in Pakistan.

all_citations.claim: The organization operates Al-Ghazaly High School and Al-Hikmah Elementary School.
The charity reported total revenue of $4,637,834 and a program expense ratio of 71.5%.
The organization accepts charitable donations to support its educational mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains a moderate overall score due to its stable financial position and long-standing educational presence, though it lacks the high-impact data and urgency found in humanitarian relief sectors.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact data and external evaluations
Lower alignment for donors seeking high-urgency humanitarian causes

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization serves a specific religious and cultural niche within the New Jersey area, which may result in lower alignment for donors prioritizing global humanitarian crises [1]. As a Sadaqah-eligible institution, it offers a consistent track record for those looking to support local Islamic education and community development [3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates a focus on capacity building through its educational infrastructure, maintaining a program expense ratio of 71.5% [2]. While it shows financial stability with 16.3 months of working capital, there is limited publicly available data regarding specific student outcomes or cost-per-beneficiary metrics [1][2].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Islamic Education Foundation of New Jersey Inc provides comprehensive religious and academic schooling through its established elementary and high school programs.
strengths: High fundraising efficiency with $0.00 spent per $1 raised
Strong liquidity with 16.3 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: The Islamic Education Foundation of New Jersey Inc is a non-profit organization dedicated to establishing and operating pre-school, elementary, and high school institutions [1][2]. Its primary educational programs include Al-Ghazaly High School and Al-Hikmah Elementary School, which serve the local community through integrated curricula [1].
